channel.title: Zurroball working script!
channel.description:
Hey everyone, this is my first script, but it's flawless i think. i tested it for a very long time.
1. Target window. 2. Color selection is automatically picked. 3. It will automatically select the type of ball in the load screen, so just sit back and relax. 4. This program runs for Snot Ball.
Please PM me your scores if you're uncomfortable posting them on the forum. Also rate this from 1-10, keep in mind it's my first SCAR script[br][size=1]Posted at: August 30, 2006, 10:44:05 PM[/size][hr]ARGH i posted wrong one! hang on here is working Snot Ball one![br][size=1]Posted at: August 30, 2006, 10:45:09 PM[/size][hr]HERE IT IS.
sorry guys.[br][size=1]Posted at: August 30, 2006, 10:46:08 PM[/size][hr]omfg what happened? ok no one download this i'll have it back up in sec. downlaod zurroball-3 when i upload it

item.title: Zurroball working script!
item.dc:creator: @mindtempest mindtempest
item.description:
@mindtempest wrote:

i suggest you dont use tolerance, you can just use a simple getcolor on the ball when it starts, and just use findcolor on that color, like on my script.

Read full topic

item.title: Zurroball working script!
item.dc:creator: @mellinox mellinox
item.description:
@mellinox wrote:

oh yeah sorry, did you target the screen? and if it doesn’t still work, then try to add Sleep(65) under clickmouse(x,y,true);

that’ll help you a lot[br][size=1]Posted at: August 30, 2006, 10:59:17 PM[/size][hr]yeah the sleep command will help with the flying in the air 10k feet up[br][size=1]Posted at: August 30, 2006, 10:59:40 PM[/size][hr]Sleep(30) amd (45) work too[br][size=1]Posted at: August 30, 2006, 11:00:57 PM[/size][hr]115 looks flawless

Read full topic
